appendix.title: Keyboard shortcuts in the editor
appendix.para: This short text describes key behaviour in the editor pane. Term ""move to inside segment" means, that the caret moves to the start of segment, if the previous position was before the segment, and to its end, if the previous position was past the end of it.

appendix.para: * These keys behave differently when the caret is outside the editable segment:

listitem.para: Any char key, if clicked outside editable segment, will be ignored.

appendix.para: "Shift" key doesn't exhibit any special behaviour per se - it just adds the selection from the old to the new caret position. All keys move caret the same way, when the "Shift" key is pressed, as they do without it.

System-wide commands: Paste (Ctrl+V or Ctrl+Insert), Cut (Ctrl+X or Ctrl+Delete), Insert match (Ctrl+I) and Insert source (Ctrl+Shift+I) act in principle on any selection, including those bigger than the editable segment. In such a case the selection will of course be pared down to segment boundaries.
